intro: Heracleum elegans, commonly known as the slender cowparsnip, is a tall biennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hollow, ridged stems and large, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks. Heracleum elegans is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
